newsitem.title: USA: AccelGraphics in PC pact with Gateway 2000.
newsitem.headline: AccelGraphics in PC pact with Gateway 2000.

text.p: Software company AccelGraphics Inc on Tuesday said Gateway 2000 Inc will build some of its computer workstations with AccelGraphics 3D sub-systems.
Financial details of the deal were not disclosed.
The Gateway workstations will be based on Intel Corp's 300MHz Pentium II processors and will run the Windows NT and Windows 95 operating systems from Microsoft Corp.
Gateway's workstations will be available in fourth quarter of 1997, AccelGraphics said.
AccelGraphics also said it has formed eight new independent software vendor relationships and has created a dealer partner program designed to target the 3D animation market.
AccelGraphics said many of the the eight privately-held software vendors have chosen to demonstrate their Windows NT products on AccelGraphics graphics subsystems.
